bill_title: provide for the transport of certain students to centrally designated distribution points.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the transport of certain students to centrally designated distribution points. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-28-45 be amended to read as follows: 13-28-45. The parent or guardian of a student who has been accepted for transfer is responsible for transporting the student to school in the receiving district without reimbursement. Either the district of residence or the receiving district may provide transportation to students approved for transfer. However, a school district shall transport any students enrolled under the provisions of §§ 13-28-40 to 13-28-47, inclusive, to a centrally designated distribution point within the boundaries of either the receiving or resident district. The provisions of § 13-29-4 do not apply when transporting students enrolled under the provisions of §§ 13-28-40 to 13-28-47. The receiving district may charge a reasonable fee if the student elects to use the transportation services offered by the receiving district. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
